main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported near the campus of Cornell University in Ithaca, New York on different dates in 1952.
interesting points: One sighting described a light resembling a jet exhaust, while another reported a bright yellowish-white light with a green tinge.
The observed objects displayed high speeds, with estimates exceeding 700 miles per hour, and unusual maneuvers such as sudden acceleration and disappearing from view.
The sightings were reported by credible sources, including the USAF, and were acknowledged by the Air Technical Intelligence Center at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
There were no photographs accompanying the reports, and the observations did not give the impression of significant accuracy.
The submitted letters and reports were part of the Project Blue Book, a systematic study of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) by the United States Air Force.
